alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Gilmer; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Randolph, east central Gilmer, Lewis, eastern Braxton, Upshur, northern Webster, central Barbour and southern Harrison Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 906 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms 10 miles southwest of Stonewall Jackson, or 12 miles southwest of Weston, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckhannon, Weston, Philippi, Sutton, Audra State Park, Belington, Gassaway, Mill Creek, Jackson Mill, Stonewall Jackson, Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Junior, Burnsville, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flatwoods, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville and Alexander. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 53 and 111. Route 19 near mile marker 68. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for north central West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Gilmer; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur
